alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 7:15PM CST until December 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, The creek remains mostly within its banks in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. Some high stages on small feeder streams result in very localized... short-term overflows of mainstem bottomlands. Low-lying fields are briefly cut off from easy access. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 24.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 715 AM CST.
